lines.text:
[after admitting to Lois that he's Superman]
We'd better talk.
I'm in love with you.
We'd really better talk.
No! Who else is seeing this?
Well, with the satellite link up just about everybody, I mean the whole planet.
The whole planet Houston?
Earth... The whole planet Earth.

[pleased]
You may continue.
As the extraordinary story continues...

[petulantly to Zod]
Enough of this! If the whole planet is watching, cannot we show them something more interesting?
Throw down your arms and surrender. This is an order!
General Zod does not take orders. He gives them.

[watching an Army helicopter]
Look. They need machines to fly.
What bravery. Be nice to them, my dear. Blow them a kiss.
General, would you care to step outside?
Come to me, son of Jor-El, kneel before Zod!

[on herself being the only person in the world to know Superman's secret identity, to Clark]
... I didn't sleep a wink last night. Do you know what it's like to hear birds singing at dawn, after you've just spend the whole night crying...? Don't you know this is KILLING me? Have you any idea what it's like... to have you come in here every day, and not be able to talk normally to you, or show how I feel about you, or speak to anybody else about you... Hell, I don't even know what to CALL you!
[Clark Kent has been beaten in a fistfight after losing his superpowers]
Looks like from now on you'll have to have a bodyguard with you.
I don't want a bodyguard. I want the man I fell in love with.
I know, Lois. I wish he was here.

[returning from the bathroom, Clark discovers that his seat next to Lois has been taken]
Excuse me sir, you're sitting in my seat.

[referring to the bathroom Clark just exited]
You're seat's in there, four eyes.
Somebody ought to teach you some manners, sir.
Oh, yeah? Well, let me know when he comes in.

[on T.V]
This is your President. On behalf of my country and in the name of the other leaders of the world with whom I have today consulted, I hereby abdicate all authority and control over this planet to General Zod. Only by following all his directives will the lives of millions be spared...
[desperately]
Superman! Can you hear me? Superman! Where are you...
Who is this Superman?
You'll find out and when you do-...
Come to me, Superman! I defy you! Come and kneel before Zod! Zod!
This "super-man" is nothing of the kind; I've discovered his weakness.
Yes?
He cares. He actually cares for these Earth people.
Like pets?
I suppose.
Sentimental idiot!
Why do you say this to me, when you know that I will kill you for it?
[last lines]
Good afternoon, Mr. President. Sorry I've been away so long. I won't let you down again.

[upon Clark entering his office]
Kent, I need a story to run with the page three sidebard. Get me everything you can on this terrorist group.
Right!
[is about to leave but stops]
Uh, sorry. T... terrorists?
Get your head out of the closet, Kent! Where've you been for the past twelve hours?
Home.
Well, don't you watch television?
Frankly, Mr. White, I really don't enjoy television. Too much violence. I was just reading Dickens.

[races in]
Mr. Kent! A gang of terrorists seized the Eiffel Tower! In Paris!
He knows where the Eiffel Tower is, Olson!
[afterthought]
You do, don't you Kent?
Yes, sir.
[to Jimmy]
Has anybody been hurt?
Well, so far the hostages are unharmed.
The hostages?
Yeah! Tourists! About twenty of them!
Yeah, but that's just petty stuff. These guys claim that if the French government doesn't meet their demands, they've got a hydrogen bomb ready to level Paris.
Well, geez Mr. White. That's t... terrible!
That's why they call them "terrorists," Kent.

[to Zod and Company, at the half-wrecked White House]
... Hi! Lex Luthor.
[no reaction from the Super Villains]
LEX LUTHOR! Possibly you've heard the name? the Greatest Criminal Mind on Earth!
I told you this was a puny planet.
[moves menacingly towards Luthor]
Whoa whoa whoa wait... why don't you get to know me better?
[Ursa continues moving towards Luthor]
WAIT! I can give you anything! The... the... the... the Brass Ring, unlimited freedom to maim and kill! PLUS! Lex Luthor's keen mind, Lex Luthor's savvy, Lex Luthor's school of career guidance...
[Ursa begins crushing his hand]
We already have this without you. You cannot bargain with what you don't have.
The Son of Jor-El.
The Son of Jor-El?

[confused]
I just said that.
Jor-El? Our jailer?

[sarcastically]
No, Jor-El the BASEBALL PLAYER...
[Ursa and Non start moving menacingly towards Luthor]
Yes, Jor-El your jailer.
The Son of Jor-El! On this planet!
Superman.
So THIS is Superman! How do you know of Jor-El?
I'm about the best there is.
Revenge! We will kill the son of our jailer!
Revenge!
REVENGE! Now we're cooking!
He flies then?
Constantly.
He has powers as we do?
Certainly. But, oh Magnificent One, he is one, while you are three.
[Non growls]
Or four, if you count him twice!
Come! We will bring him to his knees!
Praying!
Yes, to ME!
Wait!
[the Super Villains turn to face Luthor]
First you must find him... and Lex Baby is the only one who knows where he is...
You are master of all you survey.

[bored]
So I was yesterday. And the day before.

[looking at the Presidential Seal on the floor of the Oval Office]
I see you are practiced in worshiping things that fly. Good. Now, rise before Zod.
[the "President" stands up]
Kneel before Zod.
[the "President" kneels]
You are not the President. No one who leads so many could possibly kneel so quickly.

[appears from behind the other men]
I'm the man they're protecting. I'm the President. I'll kneel before you, if it will save lives.
It will, starting with your own.

[walking towards a group of military men]
What a backwards planet this must be, where the men wear the ribbons... and the jewelry!
[rips the ribbons off a general's uniform]
What I do now, I do for the sake of the people of Earth. But there is one man on this planet who will NEVER kneel before you.
Who is this imbecile? Where is he?
I wish I knew.
[kneels]
Oh God.
Zod!

[after using heat vision on a snake]
Did you see that? Did you see what I did? I have powers beyond reason here!
We all have them, my dear.
I win. I always win. Is there no one on this planet to even challenge me?
Dwayne, you've gotta learn to kick ass if you wanna be a peacemaker.
What am I gonna do with you people, huh? I held up my end, I delivered the blue boy. What do I get from my triple threat? "Bow! Yield! Kneel!" That kind of stuff closes out a town.
Why do you say this to me when you know I will kill you for it?
Kill me? Lex Luthor? Extinguish the greatest criminal flame of our age? Eradicate the only man on Earth with...
Kill him!
...Superman's address?
Come. The three of us will crush the son of our jailer!
Come forward. Your General wishes to speak.

I am General Zod. Your ruler. Yes, today begins a new order. Your lands, your possessions, your very lives, will gladly be given in tribute to me, General Zod! In return for your obedience you will enjoy my generous protection. In other words you will be allowed to live.
[rips a Generals stars from his shoulder]
So you are a General? And who is your superior?
I answer only to the President.
And he will answer to me! Or all of his cities will end up like this one.
He's dead. Superman is dead! He's not coming out.
They've killed Superman! What are we gonna do now?
Let's go get 'em ourselves! C'mon, I know some judo.
Why didn't you go before we left?
That was two days ago.
Crude noisemaker.

[to Superman]
And now... finally. Take my hand and swear eternal loyalty to Zod.

[finding General Zod and Company standing on a dirt road, the Sheriff kicks in his car's lights and siren; to Duane]
From the look of 'em, I'll bet ten dollars they're from Los Angeles.
[to the Kryptonians]
Hey, you hippies! Get your butts off the road!
I like the glow that flashes red like our Krypton sun. But not this irritating noise. Make way.
Did you think we would give up our advantage? No. The son of Jor-El will be my slave... forever. Or else, the millions of Earthlings you protect shall pay for your defiance.

[Lex arrives]
Hi, guys. Sorry I'm late.
We have no more use for this one. Kill him.
Me? Lex Luthor? General, you came to me with nothing. I gave you Superman!
Silence!
Son of Jor-El. We were beginning to think you were a coward.
I'm not a coward, Zod.
Let him prove it!
Possibly not. It is extremely likely you are merely a fool. Like father, like son.
Somehow, I just can't hear you, Zod.

[Using his heat vision, he breaks off the entire side of a nearby building and catches it with both hands]
Then die, as you deserve to!
[He throws it at Superman, who uses his own heat vision to blow the huge projectile apart]
What an undemanding male this Superman must be.
Yeah, and you could use a tuck here and there yourself, sister.
I like trees.
So does your average cocker spaniel.

[as somebody pulls a gun on him]
These humans are beginning to bore me.

[as he's strolling through the half-demolished Daily Planet, in the wake of General Zod's minions; to himself]
... Even with all this accumulated knowledge, when will these dummies learn to use a DOOR KNOB?
[to everyone]
Howdy, folks! You should see the White House; they'll be cleaning it for months.

[at the Fortress of Solitude; whispering to Luthor]
Try and get them all into this molecule chamber. It takes away their powers, see... and turns them into ordinary human beings. Now if you could...
[Zod approaches]
Shh, shh!

[pauses]
General, don't go in there. It's a trap.
Luthor, you poisonous snake!
That's a molecule chamber. It turns people like you into people like me.

[nods]
You've done well, Lex Luthor.

[pointing]
The crystal there activates the mechanism.
Lex Luthor, ruler of Australia... activate the machine.
[Non grabs Luthor and flies him up to the control panel]

[on the moon]
You. What kind of a creature are you?
Just a man.
A man?
[Eve Teschmacher & Luthor are in a balloon over the arctic, after escaping the penetentiary & leaving Otis behind]
Lex, how could you do that to Otis?
What else is ballast for?
If Paris is going to go kablooie I want my best reporter right in the middle of it... No offense, Kent. You're good, but Lois Lane's better.
It's not that; I mean, isn't that awfully dangerous for her?
That goes with the territory, Kent. Relax; if I know Lois Lane, she'll not only come back with a Pulitzer Prize story, but a one-on-one interview with the hydrogen bomb titled "What Makes Me Tick."

[unaware that Zod and Company have just wiped out the entire Artemis 2-crew]
... What did Nate say a minute ago? He saw a girl?
I thought he said "curl."
What's a curl?
Isn't that what the old Cape Cannaveral guys called a comet with an east-west trajectory?
How would I know? I was in high school back then.
You look old for your age... Well, it looks like your run-of-the-mill, high-frequency electrical interference.
All right...
[to the other controllers]
... Which one of you guys is using the hair-dryer?
No one may leave without my permis -
[spots Willie escaping on horseback]
I said no one leaves!
[at Zod's direction, Non hurls a projectile, obliterating Willie and his horse]
He was only a boy!
Who will never become a man!
I have to go back.
You can't go back, there's no way now.
I have to. I've gotta try dammit, I've got to try something. Anything!
It's not your fault. You didn't know this was going to happen.
They knew. They tried to tell me. But, I didn't listen.
[Arriving on Earth after overhearing some NASA astronauts]
So this is planet Houston.
Superman! Thank God!
[sees Zod glaring at him]
I mean, get him!
I'm gonna' be fine. Don't worry about me.
I like worrying about you.
I've never seen garbage eat garbage before.

[after their carnage on the moon]
Strange, I tore those metal fibers like paper. And what HE did... was amazing! Something is happening...
Yes, to all of us. The closer we come to an atmosphere with only one sun, a yellow sun, the more our molecular density gives us unlimited powers.

[pointing to Earth]
They come from there, a place called Houston.
Then we will go there to rule. FINALLY, to rule.
[turning to Ursa]
And you, will shall everything you wish.
Men! To kill!
And I will lead!

[picking up the stunned astronaut]
What sort of fragile life-form is this...?

[watching the villains]
I haven't seen the likes of this since Superman.

[referring to Mount Rushmore]
Thousands of hours to build, and they defaced it in seconds. Imagine what they'll do to the world if we resist!

[just before using heat vision on Metropolis]
I'll draw his fire... with some of my own.
If you intend to live your life with a mortal, you must live *as* a mortal.
Please, Mister.
He's a General.
Please, Mister General! Please let my daddy down!
If he cares so much for these humans...
[grabs Lois]
... why not take his favorite?
Hey sweet thing, set them buns down here!

[she sits and holds out her arm]
Let's just hold hands.

[he takes her hand]
Let me know if this tickles.
[she throws him, breaking the table]
I think my arm's broken.
Girl or no girl, you're gonna spit teeth. Get up!
[Zod flings him through the bar wall into the dirt road, right in front of Willie and the Sheriff]
Once a girl's seen Superman in action, Niagara Falls kind of leaves you cold. You know what I mean?
North... Why does he always go north?
He wants to ski?

[Sees that General Zod has taken over the world]
Here? When?
When? Where the hell have you been? On a Desert Island?

[after Superman catches the boy that fell over the railing]
Oh what a nice man!
Of course, He's Jewish you know.
Well, let's see what trouble I can get into today. Lueene. What's happening in the world?
[Lueene rolls her eyes and walks out of Lois's office]
Lueene?
[Lois shrugs and gets back to work]

[referring to Superman's home]
Scruffy. Morbid. A sentimental replica of a planet long since vanished. No style at all!
I expect better manners from my guests, Zod.
Superman, this wasn't my idea...!
Accept your destiny, Kal-El. As your father once condemned us, so now do we condemn his misbegotten brat!
How're we gonna get over that wall?
How'd we get in here?
We flew in, doncha remember?
That's how we're gonna get out.

[to Superman]
Guy's a clod. Promises were made, gifts exchanged. I gotta hand it to you, you know. You always told the truth, a guy always knew where he stood with you.

[as she and Lex Luthor explore Superman's Fortress of Solitude]
... Frankly, I think this place is a bit boring. I mean, it's all WHITE! Why doesn't this Superman guy put up some nice posters here... Maybe some bullfighting stuff, or a pool table...!

[offscreen from a balloon]
Psst.
Did you do "psst?"
No, but I wish I had before we left.
Psst.
Not that "psst", *that* "psst."
Psst.
Psst.
Psst.
Don't go "psst" when I go "psst".
Oh.
Get out there and find it.
Okay. What am I looking for?
You'll know it when you see it.
Oh. Psst.

[after rampaging through the Daily Planet, Zod thinks he has found Superman. He holds Jimmy way up by the collar]
... *This* is the son of Jor-El?
No, but I'll bet *you're* the son of a...!

[cutting him off]
*Jimmy!*
[first lines]
Alert, alert, alert.

[after seeing Zod on TV]
Here? When?
When? Where the hell have you been, mac, on a desert island?
I offer you a chance for greatness, Jor-El! Take it!
[ranting as Jor-El turns his back on Zod and walks away]
You will bow down before me! No matter that it takes an eternity, you will bow down before me - you, and one day, your heirs!
You three criminals have been caught in a further act of seditious treason.

[to Zod]
General Zod, your only feeling was contempt for our society; your only desire was to command.
to rule at his side.

[to Non]
Non, you are as without thought as you are without voice.
This council has no hesitation in proclaiming you all...
Guilty!
Guilty!
Guilty!
Guilty!

[the dome opens, and the Phantom Zone portal enters the chamber; Zod, Ursa and Non are transported into the Phantom Zone]
Aah!
Aah! You will bow down before me, Jor-El! Both you and one day, your heir! Jor-El!
Did you think we would give up our advantage? Now... the son of Jor-El will be my slave... forever, if not, the millions of Earthlings you protect shall pay for your defiance. Destroy this place.
Hi, guys. Sorry I'm late.
We have no more use for this one, kill him.
Me? Lex Luthor? General... you came to me with nothing, I gave you Superman!
Silence!
Well, look -
[Non shoves Luthor from behind]
Watch it, don't touch me!
[to Superman]
Guy's a clod; promises were made, gifts exchanged. I gotta hand it to you, you know. You always told the truth, a guy always knew where he stood with you.
Hmm.
[whispers to Lex Luthor]
Try and get them all into this molecule chamber. It takes away their powers, see... and turns them into ordinary human beings. Now if you could -
[Zod approaches]
Shh, shh!
General, don't go in there, it's a trap.
Luthor, you poisonous snake!
That's a molecule chamber. It makes people like you into people like me.
You've done well, Lex Luthor.
General, uh... the crystal there, uh... activates the mechanism.
Lex Luthor, ruler of Australia... activate the machine.
[Non grabs Luthor and flies him up to the control panel]
Thank you.
[takes a crystal]
With your permission.
[Lois cries as Superman enters the chamber and the lights turn on]

[Superman exits the chamber, and proceeds to kneel before Zod]
And now... finally. Take my hand... and swear eternal loyalty to Zod.
[Superman grips Zod's hand and crushes it]
Ahhh, uuuuh! Oooohhh, ahhh!
[Superman lifts Zod off the ground]
Oooh, oh no!
[Superman throws Zod against the Fortress's wall, where he falls into the chasm below]
Ugggh!
Urgh!
[Non tries to fly, but falls off the cliff, into the chasm below]
Huh? Ohhhh!
He switched it, he did it to them! I mean, the lights were on out here... while he was safe in there!
[Superman nods and gives Luthor an OK sign]
You know something? You're a real pain in the neck!
[Lois punches Ursa into the chasm below]
Uurghhhh!

[Lois goes to Superman, who hugs her]
Are you all right?
Mm-hmm.
I knew you'd double-cross me, Luthor. A lying weasel like you couldn't resist the chance.
Me, are you kidding? Hey, I was with you all the time! That was beautiful! Did you see the way they fell into our trap? Ha ha ha ha!
Too late, Luthor! Too late.

Look - look, Superman, I got- I got a proposition for you. Now, now don't stop me, don't stop until you've heard me because... I know I owe you one, but we're in the North Pole, right? Let's wipe the slate clean. If you give me a ride back, I promise I'll turn over a whole new leaf...
